step1.sentence: Despite numerous setbacks, she managed to carry through her ambitious renovation project by the end of the year.

step2.story: Marcus had promised his team he would carry through the product launch no matter what obstacles arose. When a key supplier dropped out last minute, he worked through the weekend to find an alternative. The launch went ahead on schedule, and his team's trust in him grew stronger than ever.

step3.story: For three years, Elena had been planning a community garden project in her neighborhood, but funding and bureaucratic hurdles kept stalling her progress. Friends told her to give up, saying the city council would never approve it, but she refused to let the dream die. She gathered signatures, attended every council meeting, and rallied local businesses to donate materials. Slowly, the opposition softened and the permits came through. Last spring, Elena finally carried through her vision, and the garden now blooms where an empty lot once stood. Every Saturday, children and elderly residents gather there, and Elena knows every struggle was worth it.

meaning.realUsageKo: 계획이나 약속, 목표를 어려움에도 불구하고 끝까지 완수하거나 성사시킬 때 사용한다. 주로 'carry through a plan', 'carry through with something' 형태로 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'carry'는 고대 프랑스어 'carier'(운반하다)에서 유래했고, 'through'는 고대 영어 'þurh'(끝까지, 관통하여)에서 왔다. 합쳐져서 '끝까지 밀고 나가다'는 의미가 됐다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 완료했다는 것보다 장애물이나 어려움이 있었음에도 불구하고 포기하지 않고 완수했다는 의지와 인내의 뉘앙스가 강하다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He promised to carry through the reforms he had proposed.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 자신이 제안한 개혁을 완수하겠다고 약속했다.
